basics.name: Kevin Enrique Loera Salazar
basics.label: Front-end Developer with +4 years of experience and music composer in my free time
basics.summary: I am a highly skilled and experienced Front-End Developer with over 4 years of experience in building high-quality, user-friendly web applications. I have excellent communication and collaboration skills. In my curent job, I led a team of 3 developers in the delivery of a major project.

work.name: Geest
work.summary: I've created a lot of projects, tools and sections for this web app. Dynamic graphs that can be resized and reordered on a dynamic dashboard, a full working text editor with highly custom styling, mark down, dynamic fields from tasks an more, and even a pdf editor and generator from scratch and a lot more.
highlights: Team lead of front end team

work.name: Gorilas Online
work.summary: My job on this company was create almost 4 landing pages per week with React or Vue, with Tailwind, Bootstrap, SCSS, CSS or Styled-Components, and make changes on old pages from current clients.

work.name: Freelance web development
work.summary: My first project we're a lot of landing pages as a freelance, knocking doors on local stores asking if they need my services.

projects.name: PDF Editor
projects.description: A fully functional PDF editor created from scratch. It not only serves to configure and edit them, but also to automatically generate them with data collected from other parts of the web application.

projects.name: Text Editor
projects.description: A full-featured text editor, with a wide variety of possible formats. From adding color, alignment, titles, and font, to shortcuts and fields with dynamic content linked to other parts of the web application for generating text templates.

projects.name: Dynamic graphs, drag and drop grid
projects.description: A grid for sorting, resizing, and visualizing different types of charts. From bar charts, through doughnut charts, to entire tables created with dynamic queries chosen by the user.

entries.title: Idea Oriented Programming
entries.content: About three years ago, when I saw object-oriented programming for the first time, I realized a curious thing, and it is that it has a great resemblance to Plato's Theory of Ideas...
